page.title: 04Ecology
page.content: The main land cover consists of Downland , weald and low lying meadow. As the South Downs run through this area there are many footpaths including the famous South Downs Way. At Tottington Barn there is a Youth Hostel used by walkers. Close by at Truleigh Hill there is an aircraft navigation aid and telephone microwave tower. As a contrast further along there is a Tumulus and a Mottle and Bailey. As well as the South Downs Way there is also a bridleway. Pond restoration is taking place, 2 have been reclaimed, tree planting and fencing under the auspices of the conservationists . Most of the chalk and gravel pits are now disused and are used as infills for rubbish. Many wild species of flowers thrive on the chalky soil of the South Downs.
